name: ManageIncidentStatus
description:
Manage PagerDuty incident status and assignments.

This tool allows you to acknowledge, resolve, escalate, or reassign a PagerDuty incident. It should be used when you need to update the status or assignment of an existing incident. OAuth scope 'incidents.write' is required.

parameters.name: incident_id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the incident to be managed.

parameters.name: accept_header_version
parameters.description: Specifies the versioning for the API request as an Accept header.

value_schema.description: The `Accept` header is used as a versioning header.

parameters.name: content_type
parameters.description: Set to 'application/json' for the request content type.

parameters.name: user_email_for_request
parameters.description: Email address of a valid user associated with the account making the request.

value_schema.description: The email address of a valid user associated with the account making the request.

parameters.name: incident_update_parameters
parameters.description: JSON containing details to update the incident, including status, priority, title, and assignments.

status.description: The new status of the incident. If the incident is currently resolved, setting the status to "triggered" or "acknowledged" will reopen it. When reopening an incident to the "triggered" status, it will be assigned based on the assignees or escalation_policy fields in the request, otherwise it will be assigned to the current Escalation Policy. When reopening an incident to the "acknowledged" status, it will be assigned to the current user.

priority.description: The priority of the incident. Can be provided as a priority object or a string matching a priority name. If a string is provided, the highest priority with a matching name will be used.

resolution.description:
The resolution for this incident. This field is used only when setting the incident status to resolved.
The value provided here is added to the incident’s 'Resolve' log entry as a note and will not be displayed directly in the UI.

title.description: The new title of the incident.

escalation_level.description: Escalate the incident to this level in the escalation policy.

assignments.description: Assign the incident to these assignees.

name.description: The name of the Incident Type.

conference_number.description: The phone number of the conference call for the conference bridge. Phone numbers should be formatted like +1 415-555-1212,,,,1234#, where a comma (,) represents a one-second wait and pound (#) completes access code input.

conference_url.description: An URL for the conference bridge. This could be a link to a web conference or Slack channel.

service.description: Assign the incident to this service.

incident.description: The parameters of the incident to update.
